item.title: My journey
item.description: My career so far has been a wonderfully ecclectic adventure. In this post I provide a brief summary of my experiences and how they led me to my current position at Cornell. 1. University of Winnipeg 2012 - 2016 I completed my undergraduate degree in Psychology at the University of Winnipeg. I also took courses in philosophy and economics. While studying, I worked as a research assistant for different professors in the psychology department.

item.title: About Me
item.description: I am a PhD student in Cornell’s Policy Analysis and Management program. I have experience in research, product development, and business strategy. I am passionate about a lot of things. Here is an abbreviated list in no particular order: Quantitative social science Business strategy Coding Travelling Creating a more fair, inclusive economy If you care to learn more about me, I’ve written a blog post about the my experiences at each step of my career journey.

item.title: extra_text
item.description: Through policy, governments set the rules of the game that all firms and workers play. I want to change the rules so that the game gives fairer rewards and everyone has a more equal chance at success. Why do people flock to major cities despite ever-rising costs of living? Why is competition declining across industries? How did elite education become a necessary and sufficient condition for economic success? Answering these questions requires accessing new kinds of data, revealing hidden social networks, identifying causal mechanisms, and understanding economic incentives.
